values.label: Independence
values.text: We conduct objective and impartial analyses, minimizing the interference of political preferences, ensuring rigor and commitment to research.

values.label: Commitment
values.text: We are dedicated to identifying and proposing actions that generate positive and real impact on public security.

values.label: Community Appreciation
values.text: We recognize the importance of the community and the populations served by the programs we evaluate, always seeking improvements for all involved.

values.label: Social Relevance
values.text: We prioritize topics of high social relevance, presenting proposals that respond to the most urgent challenges in public security.

section.text: Change the paradigm of public security, from a reactive approach to one focused on the prevention of violence and crime deterrence, so that violence no longer interrupts dreams.

people.name: Joana Monteiro
people.description: PhD in Economics (PUC-Rio) and Professor of Public Policy at FGV/EBAPE. Joana has held prominent positions in the Rio de Janeiro government, such as director of the Public Security Institute (2015-2018) and head of research at the State Public Prosecutor's Office (2019-2021). Previously, she was Tinker Visiting Professor at the University of Chicago (2023), Visiting Fellow at Columbia University (2021-2022), and Research Fellow at Harvard University (2009-2012). She is affiliated with Evidence in Governance and Politics (EGAP), guest researcher at J-PAL/MIT, member of the Global Initiative Against Transnational Organized Crime (GI-TOC), and a board member of the Multidimensional Security School (ESEM-IRI-USP) and LACEA-AlCapone. More information: Website, Lattes, and LinkedIn.
